page.title: 06Farming.
page.content: All land in the Block is owned by either Mr.D.Weston or J.L.Roughton both of whom own very large farms. The land in the Block is almost ent- irely arable and increased mechaniz- ation has meant better yields but also the loss of small farms and a rise in unemployment locally. Britain belongs to the European Econ- omic Community and controls and incen- tives are placed on certain crops each year.On Mr.Roughton's farm this year the following was grown: { Land allocated Crop 297.186 hectares Oilseed rape 905.868 " Winter wheat 105.856 " Potatoes 180.652 " Winter barley Many ordinary people have said how wrong it is that these yields are beyond our needs and are stored instead of feeding the world's hungry.
